description: This alarm is set when an iSD detects that the SSL accelerator
hardware fails. The iSD will continue to handle traffic, but with
severly degraded performance.

event.Summary: iSD $v4 detected SSL accelerator hardware failure

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ALTEON-ISD-SSL-MIB::alteonISDSSLHwFail ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmSeverity i 0 ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmTime s EXAMPLEE ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmCause s EXAMPLE ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::isdIP a 192.0.2.1

description: The perceived severity of the fault. A manager can set
this value to clear only. When set to clear, the alarm
is removed from this table, and a 'clearAlarm' event is
generated.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmSeverity

description: The time the fault was detected.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmTime

description: The probable cause of the alarm.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmCause

description: The IP address of the iSD box
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::isdIP

description: This alarm is set when an iSD detects that the USER is not logged
in to a HSM board on the iSD. USER must be logged in for the iSD
to process SSL traffic.

event.Summary: iSD $v4 detected that the USER is not logged in to HSM board

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ALTEON-ISD-SSL-MIB::alteonISDSSLHsmNotLoggedIn ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmSeverity i 0 ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmTime s EXAMPLEE ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmCause s EXAMPLE ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::isdIP a 192.0.2.1 ALTEON-ISD-SSL-MIB::sslHsmBoard i 0

description: The perceived severity of the fault. A manager can set
this value to clear only. When set to clear, the alarm
is removed from this table, and a 'clearAlarm' event is
generated.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmSeverity

description: The time the fault was detected.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmTime

description: The probable cause of the alarm.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmCause

description: The IP address of the iSD box
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::isdIP

description: This object specifies which HSM board in an iSD an event or alarm
is generated for.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-SSL-MIB::sslHsmBoard

description: This alarm is set when an HSM board detects that it has been
tampered with. All private keys on the board are zeroized by the
HSM board. This means that the iSD must be re-initialized, i.e.
joined again to the cluster.
The alarm must be cleared manually by loggin as 'admin' using the CLI
and follow the instructions.

event.Summary: HSM board has been tampered with; iSD must be re-initialized manually

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ALTEON-ISD-SSL-MIB::alteonISDSSLHsmTamperedWith ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmSeverity i 0 ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmTime s EXAMPLEE ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmCause s EXAMPLE ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::isdIP a 192.0.2.1 ALTEON-ISD-SSL-MIB::sslHsmBoard i 0

description: The perceived severity of the fault. A manager can set
this value to clear only. When set to clear, the alarm
is removed from this table, and a 'clearAlarm' event is
generated.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmSeverity

description: The probable cause of the alarm.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmCause

description: The IP address of the iSD box
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::isdIP

description: This object specifies which HSM board in an iSD an event or alarm
is generated for.
